title: J. J. Giltinan Shield
text:
The J.J. Giltinan Shield is an Australian <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> trophy, awarded annually to the <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">National Rugby League</a> <a href="minor%20premiership">minor premier</a>s. It was named after <a href="J%20J%20Giltinan">James J. Giltinan</a> who was central to the founding of <a href="rugby%20league%20in%20Australia">rugby league in Australia</a>. Giltinan died in 1950 and the Shield was created for the following season in his honour, first introduced for the <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season%201951">1951 New South Wales Rugby Football League season</a>. From 1951, the Shield was awarded to the winner of the <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20Rugby%20League%20premiership">New South Wales Rugby League</a> (NSWRL) <a href="Grand%20Final">Grand Final</a>, replacing the "<a href="Labor%20Daily">Labor Daily</a>" Cup. In addition to the Shield, premiership winning teams received the <a href="W.%20D.%20%26amp%3B%20H.%20O.%20Wills">W. D. & H. O. Wills</a> Cup from 1960 to 1981, the <a href="Winfield%20Cup">Winfield Cup</a> from 1982 to 1995, and the <a href="Optus%20Cup">Optus Cup</a> in 1996. Since 1997 the J.J. Giltinan Shield has been awarded to the competition's <a href="minor%20premiership">minor premier</a>s.
Winners.
1 The <a href="Melbourne%20Storm">Melbourne Storm</a> were stripped of the 2006, 2007 and 2008 minor premierships on 22 April 2010 due to <a href="Melbourne%20Storm%20salary%20cap%20breach">salary cap breaches</a>.
